attributes.additional_details:
I believe the GEO division of the Home Office should interveen in the situation regarding Albert "Dusty" Miller and The British Legion.

Mr Miller is being discriminated against as The British Legion has told him that at 89, he is now too old to take part in Rememberance Day Parades, despite the fact he is a decorated war veteran.

Age descrimination should not be tollerated and they should find an insurance company to cover Mr Miller.

We wish the GEO to ensure the British Legion change this policy'

The full article, by the daily express, can be read here:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/443425/Royal-Navy-hero-tells-how-Hitler-couldn-t-stop-him-but-health-and-safety-zealots-have
